alert.note: Alert for Dale (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 02 at 5:51PM CDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northern Dale County through 615 PM CDT... At 550 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles southwest of Blue Springs State Park, or 9 miles northeast of Ozark, moving northeast at 5 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Ozark, Ariton, Bells Crossroads, Skipperville, Dill, Roberts Crossroads, Arguta, Snells Crossroads, Barefield Crossroads, Beamon, Dale County Lake, Clopton, Marley Hill, Dillard, Phillips Crossroads, Ward Bridge, Dykes Crossroads and Bertha. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
